items.title: KFC moves U.S. headquarters from Kentucky to Texas
items.content: KFC's parent company Yum Brands is calling remote workers back to the office.
items.contentSnippet: KFC's parent company Yum Brands is calling remote workers back to the office.

items.title: U.S. homebuilders raise alarm over tariffs as sentiment falls to 5-month low
items.content: Sales expectations in the next six months took a major hit in the National Association of Home Builders' Housing Market Index.
items.contentSnippet: Sales expectations in the next six months took a major hit in the National Association of Home Builders' Housing Market Index.

items.title: Nike teams up with Kim Kardashian shapewear brand Skims as it looks to reach more women
items.content: Nike's decision to partner with Skims comes as it looks to claw back market share and return to growth under new CEO Elliott Hill.
items.contentSnippet: Nike's decision to partner with Skims comes as it looks to claw back market share and return to growth under new CEO Elliott Hill.

items.title: High-cost sickle cell gene therapies push insurers and Medicaid programs to find new payment models
items.content: The high cost of sickle cell gene therapies is pushing private insurers and Medicaid programs to develop new payment models.
items.contentSnippet: The high cost of sickle cell gene therapies is pushing private insurers and Medicaid programs to develop new payment models.

items.title: Coca-Cola takes on Olipop and Poppi with new prebiotic soda brand, Simply Pop
items.content: The U.S. prebiotic soda category has more than doubled over the last five years.
items.contentSnippet: The U.S. prebiotic soda category has more than doubled over the last five years.

items.title: Southwest Airlines to slash 15% of corporate jobs in 'unprecedented' move to cut costs
items.content: Southwest is cutting about 1,750 corporate jobs in a race to cut costs.
items.contentSnippet: Southwest is cutting about 1,750 corporate jobs in a race to cut costs.

items.title: Delta plane crashes on landing at Toronto airport, all 80 aboard survive
items.content: A Delta Air Lines flight flipped over after landing at Toronto Pearson International Airport on Monday afternoon, and all on board survived.
items.contentSnippet: A Delta Air Lines flight flipped over after landing at Toronto Pearson International Airport on Monday afternoon, and all on board survived.

items.title: Restaurants warn of weak first quarter, but say sales will pick up later this year
items.content: Freezing temperatures, wildfires and a still-cautious consumer led to lower sales in January.
items.contentSnippet: Freezing temperatures, wildfires and a still-cautious consumer led to lower sales in January.

items.title: How crazy popcorn buckets became big business for movie theaters
items.content: Specialty items like the "Dune: Part Two" popcorn bucket drive concession purchases and create a sense of urgency to see big movies on opening weekend.
items.contentSnippet: Specialty items like the "Dune: Part Two" popcorn bucket drive concession purchases and create a sense of urgency to see big movies on opening weekend.

items.title: Here's how two apps are connecting Black-owned restaurants with new customers
items.content: EatOkra and Black Foodie Finder are two of the most popular apps showcasing and bringing new patrons to Black-owned businesses and Black food professionals.
items.contentSnippet: EatOkra and Black Foodie Finder are two of the most popular apps showcasing and bringing new patrons to Black-owned businesses and Black food professionals.

items.title: As Target and other retailers drop DEI programs, Black founders could face tougher battle to get and stay on shelves
items.content: Some retailers have walked back supplier programs intended to address the additional hurdles that Black and minority founders face, including funding.
items.contentSnippet: Some retailers have walked back supplier programs intended to address the additional hurdles that Black and minority founders face, including funding.

items.title: Roku shares surge as company halves quarterly losses, adds 4 million streaming households
items.content: Roku CEO Anthony Wood said more than half of U.S. broadband households now watch TV with Roku.
items.contentSnippet: Roku CEO Anthony Wood said more than half of U.S. broadband households now watch TV with Roku.

items.title: Moderna beats on revenue but loses more than expected as it scales down manufacturing
items.content: It marks another quarter of growing pains for the company, which is racing to launch new products and recover from the decline of its Covid business.
items.contentSnippet: It marks another quarter of growing pains for the company, which is racing to launch new products and recover from the decline of its Covid business.

items.title: CVS shares are up 45% this year — here's why it may be starting to turn its business around
items.content: Some analysts are more optimistic about CVS' ability to navigate higher-than-expected medical costs in its insurance unit moving forward.
items.contentSnippet: Some analysts are more optimistic about CVS' ability to navigate higher-than-expected medical costs in its insurance unit moving forward.

items.title: As Trump eyes more tariffs, South Korea remains safe haven for GM and Hyundai
items.content: Automakers such as Hyundai Motor and General Motors have increasingly used South Korea as a tariff-free export market to the U.S.
items.contentSnippet: Automakers such as Hyundai Motor and General Motors have increasingly used South Korea as a tariff-free export market to the U.S.

items.title: U.S. investors, Big Pharma race to find new medicines in China
items.content: U.S. investors and large pharmaceutical companies are increasingly doing deals in China as the country's biopharma sector transforms.
items.contentSnippet: U.S. investors and large pharmaceutical companies are increasingly doing deals in China as the country's biopharma sector transforms.

items.title: CFPB’s new leadership begins staff purge with dozens of employees terminated
items.content: The terminations have sowed more confusion at the bureau, as several of those being laid off had already accepted federal buyout offers, said one of the people.
items.contentSnippet: The terminations have sowed more confusion at the bureau, as several of those being laid off had already accepted federal buyout offers, said one of the people.

items.title: Comcast and NBCUniversal receive FCC inquiry on DEI initiatives
items.content: The Federal Communications Commission has sent a letter to Comcast inquiring about its DEI practices, a company spokesperson confirmed Wednesday.
items.contentSnippet: The Federal Communications Commission has sent a letter to Comcast inquiring about its DEI practices, a company spokesperson confirmed Wednesday.

items.title: CVS CEO defends pharmacy middlemen, accuses drugmakers of 'monopolistic' practices
items.content: CVS CEO David Joyner's comments come as lawmakers on both sides of the aisle and President Donald Trump have signaled interest in cracking down on PBMs.
items.contentSnippet: CVS CEO David Joyner's comments come as lawmakers on both sides of the aisle and President Donald Trump have signaled interest in cracking down on PBMs.

items.title: ESPN host Stephen A. Smith says he would be U.S. president as long as he doesn't have to campaign
items.content: ESPN personality Stephen A. Smith told CNBC Sport that he is not interested in campaigning but would be interested in being president.
items.contentSnippet: ESPN personality Stephen A. Smith told CNBC Sport that he is not interested in campaigning but would be interested in being president.

items.title: Bank of America CEO on inflation impact on U.S. economy: ‘Rates are going to stay where they are’
items.content: The Bureau of Labor Statistics reported hotter-than-expected growth in the U.S. consumer price index, forcing markets to recalibrate rate expectations.
items.contentSnippet: The Bureau of Labor Statistics reported hotter-than-expected growth in the U.S. consumer price index, forcing markets to recalibrate rate expectations.

items.title: Prebiotic soda brand Olipop valued at $1.85 billion in latest funding round
items.content: Olipop's annual sales surpassed $400 million in 2024 as competition heats up with rivals such as Poppi.
items.contentSnippet: Olipop's annual sales surpassed $400 million in 2024 as competition heats up with rivals such as Poppi.

items.title: Zelle payments top $1 trillion in 2024 as network's growth outpaces rivals including PayPal
items.content: Zelle said its user base jumped 12% to 151 million accounts in 2024, and that the total dollars sent on the platform jumped 27% from the year earlier.
items.contentSnippet: Zelle said its user base jumped 12% to 151 million accounts in 2024, and that the total dollars sent on the platform jumped 27% from the year earlier.

items.title: CVS shares pop 15% on big earnings beat, even as high medical costs drag down insurance unit
items.content: It caps off the first full quarter with David Joyner, a longtime CVS executive, as CEO of the troubled retail drugstore chain.
items.contentSnippet: It caps off the first full quarter with David Joyner, a longtime CVS executive, as CEO of the troubled retail drugstore chain.

items.title: Restaurant Brands reports 2.5% same-store sales growth, fueled by Burger King and Popeyes
items.content: Restaurant Brands' revenue climbed 26% in the quarter.
items.contentSnippet: Restaurant Brands' revenue climbed 26% in the quarter.

items.title: Biogen beats estimates on cost cuts and new drugs like Leqembi, but profit outlook falls short
items.content: Biogen expects Leqembi and new rare disease and depression treatments to help offset revenue lost from multiple sclerosis products.
items.contentSnippet: Biogen expects Leqembi and new rare disease and depression treatments to help offset revenue lost from multiple sclerosis products.

items.title: Tom Brady buys ownership stake in sports collectibles company
items.content: Tom Brady will acquire a 50% stake in CardVault, a sports card and memorabilia retailer, the company announced on Wednesday.
items.contentSnippet: Tom Brady will acquire a 50% stake in CardVault, a sports card and memorabilia retailer, the company announced on Wednesday.

items.title: Tequila, mezcal are the only spirits growing in sales, but tariffs would be 'catastrophic,' industry group says
items.content: U.S. spirits sales declined in 2024 despite maintaining its market share ahead of beer and wine. Tequila and Mezcal grew, but tariffs could change that.
items.contentSnippet: U.S. spirits sales declined in 2024 despite maintaining its market share ahead of beer and wine. Tequila and Mezcal grew, but tariffs could change that.

items.title: Super Bowl 59 attracts record 127.7 million viewers
items.content: Super Bowl 59 attracted 127.7 million viewers across Fox's broadcast network as well as streaming platforms, according to Nielsen.
items.contentSnippet: Super Bowl 59 attracted 127.7 million viewers across Fox's broadcast network as well as streaming platforms, according to Nielsen.

items.title: Coca-Cola says it will sell more soda in plastic bottles if aluminum tariffs take effect
items.content: Coca-Cola can also find domestic aluminum sources and increase the price for customers, CEO James Quincey said.
items.contentSnippet: Coca-Cola can also find domestic aluminum sources and increase the price for customers, CEO James Quincey said.
